actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: A bill to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to revise the application of the overtime compensation provisions of that act to public employees engaged in public utility functions or other functions operated on a continuous basis.

summary.text: Provides under the Fair Labor Standards Act that an employee of a political subdivision of a State who is engaged in a public utility or other function operated on a continuous basis, and who has entered into an agreement designating a work period of 28 consecutive days for purposes of overtime compensation, then such political subdivision shall be considered in compliance with the Act if the employee receives compensation of one and a half times the regular rate for any employment in excess of eight hours in any workday, or one hundred and sixty hours in such twenty-eight-day period.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to revise the application of the overtime compensation provisions of that act to public employees engaged in public utility functions or other functions operated on a continuous basis.
